intro: Licania coriacea, commonly known as the rough licania, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmately lobed leaves. It produces showy yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Licania coriacea plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
